text: The mayor of the Commune of Linares is the highest authority of the Illustrious Municipality of the city, and is in charge of running local public services. He holds office for 4 years with the possibility of re-election, and is democratically elected by citizens through universal suffrage and voluntary. Mario Meza Vásquez is currently in office. == List of mayors == The following list of the mayors of the Chilean commune of Linares Name Period Party Took office Left office Casimiro Tapia 1806 Dionisio Sotomayor 1810 Juan de Urrutia y Villagra 1812 Jose Dionisio Vela (1st) Luis Jordan Tocornal (2nd) Jose Agustin Barros Varas (3rd) May 10, 1873 Benjamin Novoa (1st) Bernabe Ferrada (2nd) 1891 1894 Juan Domingo Palacios (1st) Manuel Isidoro Cruz (2nd) 1894 1897 Juan Segundo Benitez 1897 1900 Juan E.
